More importantly, it's currently bringing me deep and deeply needed moments of untainted, childlike, vaguely-Orkish joy.
Read more
articles.title: Besiege: The Splintered Sea review: a small vessel for expansive seafaring

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
Activision have celebrated my birthday in the traditional manner by announcing a new Call Of Duty game. Said Call Of Duty game is Black Ops 6, "a dark new chapter" in the Treyarch-helmed FPS sub-series which is known for seedier and weirder, alt-historical or post-future stories featuring hallucinations and cybernetics and catchy period music.
  
Read more
articles.title: Call Of Duty 2024 revealed as Call Of Duty: Black Ops 6, "a dark new chapter"

articles.author: James Archer
articles.description:
The Asus ROG Ally X, a sort of semi-sequel to last year’s ROG Ally handheld PC, has had its specs spilled over at Videocardz. I’m usually a lot more suspicious of hardware leaks, which are often just out-of-date or otherwise inaccurate info, but I’ve also sat through enough mic-muted prebriefings to know an official slideshow when I see one, and that appears to be exactly what Videocardz got its hands on. Besides, these specs include a gigantic 80Whr battery upgrade (doubling the ROG Ally’s 40Whr capacity), so we can at least file this under "News James wants to be true."
Read more
articles.title: Looks like the Asus ROG Ally X will get a honking great battery upgrade

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
Skulls! You’ve got one. I’ve got one. Everybody has a lovely skull keeping their lovely face right where it should be. Warhammer is big, so it needs must have multiple of them, hence their yearly event Skulls, which collates a bunch of Games Workshop related announcements into a sort of bizzaro world Nintendo Direct if Yoshi was actually a parasitic corpse emperor. There’s usually at least a few game announcements in there, and this year was a bumper. The headline announcement being an upcoming sequel to well-loved space-pope turn-based strategy Warhammer 40,000: Mechanicus. Yes, yes. I’m getting to the dog.
 
Read more
articles.title: Warhammer 40,000: Mechanicus is getting a sequel and Total War: Warhammer 3 is getting a big red dog

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
Videogames and especially role-playing games are chock-full of sheltered upbringings that go tits up. Innocent times and places like the prologue for Baldur's Gate, which unfolds in the vast, fortified monastery of Candlekeep (beware spoilers from this point on).
BioWare's first ever RPG opens with your unsuspecting Chosen One learning the ropes from the old sage Gorion. There are fetchquests that take you around the enormous citadel, bits of combat training to do, cosy formative chinwags to have with characters like your childhood friend Imoen. But it's not to last, of course: Gorion is murdered, and you must rove the Sword Coast in pursuit of his killer. When you return to Candlekeep later in the game, this once-proud bastion of learning has been filled with doppelgangers of Gorion and other acquaintances, a parade of chatbots waiting to stab you in the back.
 
Read more
articles.title: How Baldur's Gate 3 might have brought back Candlekeep, the library fortress where Baldur's Gate began

articles.author: James Archer
articles.description:
While I’ve always thought the race towards graphical hyperrealism isn’t as pervasive as it's often perceived, Senua's Saga: Hellblade 2 is definitely one of those games. The kind that probably has twelve artists dedicated to the recreation of visible pores, that sort of thing. It’s so focused on looking pretty that it hasn’t even noticed the title and subtitle got mixed up.
Sure enough, Hellblade 2 is a harsh test for older hardware, with a heavy reliance on DLSS or FSR upscaling to keep performance sweet. That said, it’s no Dragons Dogma 2-style technical horrorshow either. A happy balance of visuals and smoothness is attainable on plush PCs and low-end laptops alike, while DLSS 3 frame generation can deliver an effective kick in the framerate pants on RTX 40 series GPUs.
Read more
articles.title: Senua's Saga: Hellblade 2 is less of a PC hardware-killer than it looks

articles.author: Brendan Caldwell
articles.description:
In Anthology of the Killer you do not exit the game using a pause menu. You exit it by walking down a back alley into the quavering arms of two hungry bears. This is just one of many laughs your diaphragm will endure as you navigate "the escalating adventures of a girl trying to make zines in a town of giallo-style masked serial murderers". The horror comedy already won its creators the Nuovo Award at the Independent Games Festival this year, recognition that has been a long time coming for prolific game maker Stephen "thecatamites" Gillmurphy. If you're unfamiliar with his work, you can get acquainted next week, when Anthology of the Killer gets its full release on Itch.io on May 28th.  At which point you can explore its unsettling urban hell of shady corporations and cops who think they're cool. There's a trailer below.
Read more
articles.title: 'Don't worry! I'm a murderer!'  - award-winning comedy Anthology of the Killer is out next week

articles.author: James Archer
articles.description:
Sometimes you gotta know when to fold, and trying to get new hotness RPG Wuthering Waves to play nice with the Steam Deck has got me creasing like an origami crane. While its Epic Games Store release can be worked around, and Proton GE will get the game’s own launcher running, no combination of software, compatibility tools, or installation folder deep-diving seems capable of actually booting the game proper.
As such, I’m accepting defeat. Obviously with apologies to any studious Steam Deck Academy readers.
Read more
articles.title: Wuthering Waves really, really doesn’t want to run on Steam Deck

articles.author: Matt Jarvis
articles.description:
Everything And Then The Licensed Kitchen Sink fighting game MultiVersus returns next week after an almost year-long self-imposed post-beta exile. With the decision to pull the game from sale and turn off its servers for months on end after allowing people to sink their real-life money into unlocking costumes and such (with no refunds), its developers are now looking to seemingly give something back in return.
Read more
articles.title: You’ll get Warner Bros brawler MultiVersus’ premium battle pass for free if you played the beta

articles.author: Matt Jarvis
articles.description:
The classic anime series Gundam examines the traumatic experience of war, particularly the unalterable effect it has on those young soldiers forced to participate in the horrors of fighting for their life while taking the lives of others using weapons of inhuman strength and devastation. Which clearly makes it the perfect fit for a bit of upcoming DLC for military-fetishising interactive gun range Call of Duty.
Read more
articles.title: Call of Duty is getting in the (Gundam) robot

articles.author: Matt Jarvis
articles.description:
We already know that a full-blown sequel to swampy extraction shooter Hunt: Showdown probably isn’t on the cards right now, but developers Crytek appear to be lining up the next major update for the 2019 PvPvE cryptid-slayer as almost a whole new game regardless.
Read more
articles.title: Hunt: Showdown’s massive summer update isn’t Hunt 2, but the “significant relaunch” marks “a whole new era”

articles.author: Ed Thorn
articles.description:
In a twist of fate I've mentioned in some recent Destiny 2 news posts, I am fully back into Destiny. Former vidbud Liam and I used it, initially, as something we could do while catching up on life. But now? Now we're all in. Liam has created a spreadsheet of things we're ticking off to prepare for the upcoming expansion, and I think it's the perfect summation of what the game is to us: something that makes no sense at all and yet something that makes our brains hum with happiness.
And what we've found with Destiny, in all of its bloat, is that we haven't explored for a single second since our return. Everything is accomplished through menus, making it quite Starfield-esque, which is terrible… but also good. We can't make sense of it and we don't think we ever will.
Read more
articles.title: Destiny 2 is mighty lucky it has good shooting because it's impenetrable otherwise

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
I'm not sure it's even worth that, to be honest. Messed my back up a right old treat. 
 
Read more
articles.title: You can get my old battered gamer chair for, oh I dunno, 50 quid?

articles.author: James Archer
articles.description: Graphics... cards? Cards. House of cards. House of... graphics cards?
articles.title: Screw it, I'm building a house of graphics cards

articles.author: Ed Thorn
articles.description:
Hauntii sets the scene with a rather magical opening sequence. A beam of light shoots out of a mysterious planet and a zoom in reveals the beam to be an asteroid, but not just any asteroid: a crystal shaped like a teardrop, with a little ghost nestled inside. You awaken as this little ghost, who it turns out, has crash landed in Eternity (and who, it turns out, is called Hauntii). Soon you bump into a ghostly girl, who guides you to a tower that thrusts you both up to a higher plane - but though she ascends, you're dragged back to the bottom at the last moment by some netherworldly chains. And so, as Hauntii you travel through Eternity to discover who that girl was and, ultimately, how to ascend to those heavenly skies yourself.
Read more
articles.title: Hauntii review: an adventure as beautiful as it looks

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description: PC gaming news, previews, reviews, opinion.
articles.title: Why do game cutscenes always fade to white?: a sincere plea on behalf of the mole people

articles.author: Brendan Caldwell
articles.description:
At RPS we like Alices. When somebody comes along with the name "Alice" you don't just say "oh hi" like some insolent rube. You nod with solemn respect and you say, "Alice". An Alice is someone you should not take lightly, nor take for granted, nor leave unmonitored. For they will destroy worlds and build better ones while you are not looking. This is dangerous and exciting. Alices are a force to be reckoned with. To treat an Alice poorly is to invite shame, dishonour, and contempt. Here are some of the best Alices in video games!
Read more
articles.title: The best Alices in PC games

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
We just got a new Elden Ring: Shadow Of The Erdtree story trailer yesterday. As is their druthers, FromSoft have at once made the events it depicts feel of earth-shattering importance while providing basically no concrete information. A lot of people will be putting out gargantuan theory posts right now, rambling on about Miquella, the Crucible, the Golden Order blah blah. This is all a distraction. Anyone with eyes can tell you that the primary movers and shakers of this final chapter in the Lands Between are a secret faction of hitherto secret spear people. You're likely confused, and that's understandable. As the foremost authority on ephemeral nonsense in Elden Ring, I’m the only one who has your back here.
 
Read more
articles.title: Here’s every spear I spotted in the new Elden Ring DLC trailer, rated for their predicted plot relevance

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
The music in haunting 2D adventure Norco was so good it’s one of the few soundtracks I’ve actually bought on Steam, so I’m deeply intrigued to learn that developer Geography of Robots are putting music - and dancing - front and center in the new demo for their next project, Silenus. You can bop your way between screens, reader!
 
Read more
articles.title: Norco makers’ new game Silenus lets you boogie in a gothic industrial hellscape

articles.author: Alice Bell
articles.description:
I could pretend I understand Square Enix's action-RPG series Kingdom Hearts, but I don't need to, 'cos what I do understand is how popular it is. Until fairly recently the nearly 15-game-strong series, where Disney characters cross over with Final Fantasy and go to war alongside a child wielding a key (I said I don't properly understand it), wasn't on PC. After some games arrived on the Epic Games Store in 2021, Squeenix have confirmed that multiple Kingdom Hearts games are coming to Steam next month, on June 13th. Unlucky for some, maybe, but not Donald Duck and Goofy, two of the main characters. Long has Goofy been seen as just a joke character in the minds of people people who didn't watch A Goofy Movie. Hopefully this brings his heroism to a wider audience.
Read more
articles.title: Kingdom Hearts is coming to Steam in June, giving Goofy the broader audience he deserves

articles.author: Ed Thorn
articles.description:
Risk Of Rain 2 is one of my fave action roguelikes, as it's a good time with pals and has all the hallmarks of things I enjoy most in my games: shooting and looting. That's why the latest free update excites me so, as it introduces an artifact that makes chests malicious and another that lets you hatch angry lizard companions. Oh, and there's a new map, too.
Read more
articles.title: Risk Of Rain 2 has a free update that lets you hatch lizard companions and turns chests into memory tests

articles.author: Brendan Caldwell
articles.description:
The neighbourhood citizens of Life By You are positioning themselves as bright-eyed pretenders to The Sims. But in this ultimate game of keeping-up-with-the-Jones, the life sim from Paradox has slipped on a wet kitchen tile. The game has been delayed for a third time, and the developers are reluctant to set a new date for the planned release into early access. "[We] believe it is more prudent to hold off while we plan ahead," said Mattias Lilja of Paradox Interactive, "rather than committing to a new date that we cannot be certain to meet." 
Read more
articles.title: Sims contender Life By You gets delayed once again, this time indefinitely

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
To borrow a tired Xitterism: The Venn diagram between ‘games that have reference points outside of other games’ and ‘games I’m likely to get excited about’ is a circle. For the benefit of people who’ve discovered the one weird trick that therapists hate and improved their mental health tenfold by deleting the bad place, here’s an incredibly cool thread I stumbled upon this morning where indie developers share non-game influences on their projects.
 
Read more
articles.title: I don’t mean to shock you, but Twitter is doing a cool thing as indie devs share their non-game inspirations

articles.author: Rick Lane
articles.description:
Three questions before we start:

1) Do you like Robert Eggers' film The Northman?
2) Do you like games that mainly involve pressing 'forward' and not much else?
3) Do you like rocks?
 
Read more
articles.title: Senua's Saga Hellblade 2 review: a visual step forward even more contemptuous of interactivity than the first

articles.author: Matt Jarvis
articles.description:
MultiVersus - aka Warner Smash Bros, or The Game Where Scooby-Doo’s Velma Punches Batman While LeBron James Decks The Iron Giant - hasn’t quite returned from its self-imposed exile after ending its open beta last year, but it’s already adding more Iconic Characters(™) to its already teetering pile of familiar Licensed IP.
Read more
articles.title: 'Warner Smash Bros' fighter MultiVersus adds Friday the 13th’s Jason and The Matrix’s Agent Smith to its already preposterous roster

articles.author: Matt Jarvis
articles.description:
This year’s rather wonderful Prince of Persia Metroid-like The Lost Crown has dropped the second of its free post-launch updates, adding a new boss rush mode, some unlockable costumes for surviving said mode, an extra way to fast-travel and more.
Read more
articles.title: Prince of Persia: The Lost Crown adds boss rush mode, extra fast-travel and an outfit from the 2008 reboot (if you can unlock it)

articles.author: Matt Jarvis
articles.description:
The next part of Undertale creator Toby Fox’s current project Deltarune is actually two parts, as chapters 3 and 4 plan to release together. It sounds like that release is still a ways off, according to a recent update from Fox, even as the latest chapter seemingly makes “great progress” and the team eye up work on Chapter 5.
Read more
articles.title: Undertale follow-up Deltarune's next part(s) are “going better than ever”, but don’t expect them anytime soon

articles.author: Matt Jarvis
articles.description:
Flashy action-RPG Stellar Blade looks like it could be the next PlayStation 5 exclusive to find its way over to PC, as developers Shift Up say they’re pondering a PC release. They’re also thinking about a sequel - probably not much of a surprise given the first game has sold well on just the one platform, by all accounts - while working on a new game that should also be headed to PC, codenamed Project Witches.
Read more
articles.title: Stellar Blade devs ‘considering’ a PC release and sequel, as next game Project Witches also eyes up PC

articles.author: Sin Vega
articles.description:
Two years of early access have been kind Songs of Conquest. Its strategy fundamentals were already strong enough to impress me in 2022 that it's been quite tricky to even remember what's changed. But there's more of it, and although after much reflection I think it's not quite, quite for me, more of a good and unusual thing is definitely enough to push me into a very nearly wholehearted endorsement.
Read more
articles.title: Songs Of Conquest 1.0 review: occasionally demanding but often rewarding fantasy warlordery

articles.author: Alice Bell
articles.description:
Wacky space station management sim Startopia and wacky hosptial sim Theme Hospital are two of my favourite older games, so I was very pleased with the concept of Galacticare, which is a wacky space station hospital management sim. And you know what? It's great! From early reveals and previews I thought it might veer into being too wacky, but it nails its tone, has some really striking levels, and bugs in earlier builds have been squashed (much as you can manually splat small parasites that make their way into your hospital). I can see this becoming a go-to comfort game for me.
Read more
articles.title: Galacticare review: a silly space sim in the Bullfrog tradition, with a great sense of humour

articles.author: Mark Harrison
articles.description:
If you're after a lightweight wireless mouse to help you win more games of Counter-Strike 2 or Valorant, then the Logitech G Pro X Superlight Wireless 2 is definitely one to consider.
Read more
articles.title: Get one of the best wireless gaming mice for less when you buy it with this mouse mat

articles.author: James Archer
articles.description:
I may have winced a bit, initially, at Alice Bee’s choice of RPS Game Club game for this month. Deathbulge: Battle of the Bands looked funny and all, but it’s a turn-based RPG, a subgenre that usually elicits the same amount of enthusiasm from me as the phrase "by Ernest Cline" does from Alice. Deathbulge, however, is a clever little sod of a game, managing to devise not only a turn-based combat system that avoids the usual waiting-around tedium but one that’s outright good fun in itself.
Read more
articles.title: Deathbulge: Battle of the Bands' greatest trick is making me enjoy turn-based combat

articles.author: Brendan Caldwell
articles.description:
There are management games and there are micro-management games. Prison Architect 2 is the latter. I don't mean this as an annoying thing, like when Harold from corporate starts commenting all over your document at 4.30pm on a Friday. I mean it as a distinction between those games that let you plop down a house, and others that need you to stack the bricks, install the plumbing, fit the lights, and select the wallpaper. The first Prison Architect allowed you to finesse every detail of a secure correctional facility, down to each cell and dog kennel. Unsurprisingly for a sim about prison, it encouraged obsessive control. The 3D-ified sequel isn't finished yet, but it's taking a similar approach. Maybe a little too similar.
Read more
articles.title: Prison Architect 2 is coming up for release, but it's hard to rehabilitate from years of 2D

articles.author: Brendan Caldwell
articles.description:
You remember the ending of 2011's first-person bullethoser Call of Duty: Modern Warfare 3, right? Everyone does! A big man kills another big man with a gun but then - then! - a third big man kills that first big man with a rope. It's dramatic stuff. Well, a data-diving enthusiast of the CoDwars has discovered a cut ending from the original trilogy's closing chapter. It's a more downbeat and mysterious finale, featuring a shadowy figure whose identity is never revealed. Also, Captain Price, the hero of the franchise and aforementioned big man number three, drops his cigar with possibly mortal implications.
Read more
articles.title: Captain Price seems to die in a cut ending from Modern Warfare 3, uncovered 13 years later

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
Baldur's Gate 3 and Divinity Original Sin developers Larian today announced the opening of a new studio in Warsaw, Poland. This is RPG outfit Larian’s seventh studio worldwide, and the latest to contribute to their "24-hour development cycle" model. That’s even more hands on deck to a) keep Swen Vincke’s armour polished to a fine sheen and b) ensure smooth sailing for the two new games that Larian currently have in the works.
 
Read more
articles.title: Larian's new Polish studio is a "match made in heaven" for the Baldur's Gate 3 developer's upcoming RPGs

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
20 years after leaving Elder Scrolls, Starfield, and Fallout 76 makers Bethesda Game Studios, veteran writer and quest designer Douglas Goodall has returned to classic RPG Morrowind with an expansive new quest mod.
 
Read more
articles.title: Veteran Morrowind quest designer returns to the setting they helped build with a huge mod project

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
This week on RPS: secret plans and clever tricks. Also, a bunch of new videogames, none of them particularly Enormous or Crocodilian. We open on Monday 20th May with the extremely Alice B-friendly combo of Little-Known Galaxy, aka Stardew Valley meets Star Trek, and A Tower Full Of Cats, a hidden object puzzler featuring a tower full of dogs, I mean cats. All very upbeat. Well, hold that thought, because on the 21st, it's time for Senua's Saga: Hellblade 2, another slice of Celtic sort-of-psychosis from Ninja Theory, which is as grim as the accompanying Paper Trail is *checks Nic's review* incredibly annoying?
  
Read more
articles.title: The Maw - 20th-25th May 2024

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
Hello reader who is also a reader, and welcome back to Booked For The Week - our regular Sunday chat with a selection of cool industry folks about books! Did you know that the word ‘book’ is actually an ancient Sumerian greeting, short for: ‘can I have that book back I lent you eight months ago you said you’d have finished in like, two? This is going to be another one of those, isn’t it?.’ Truly, language’s many permutations are a font of limitless wonder. This week, it’s Pony Island, The Hex, and Inscryption maker Daniel Mullins! Cheers Daniel! Mind if we have a nose at your bookshelf?
 
Read more
articles.title: What's on your bookshelf?: Inscryption and Pony Island's Daniel Mullins

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
Sundays are for wheeling my old gamer chair to the curb, before flopping back in my new ergonomic office chair  with the same awful posture and whining, "Why doesn't it work?! Who knew that furniture named things like Titan, Pro and Conquer aren't the most conducive to lumbar support?" Before I go, "Aaaaaaahhhhhhh" so loudly I give the local cats tiny heart attacks, let's read this week’s best writing about games (and game related things!)
 
Read more
articles.title: The Sunday Papers

articles.author: Graham Smith
articles.description:
Seablip is a pixel art pirate 'em up, which promises an open world to sail around, islands to visit, crews to hire, bounties to hunt, and minigames through which to uncover treasure and fish. It looks adorable and it's out in Early Access now.

 
Read more
articles.title: Seablip is a pixel art pirate 'em up out now in Early Access

articles.author: Graham Smith
articles.description:
Dead Cells was blessed with several excellent animated trailers, each one produced by French animation studio Bobbypills. Now the slick metroidvania is getting a full animated television series from the same folks, and the first trailer is below.

 
Read more
articles.title: Here's the first trailer for the Dead Cells animated series

articles.author: Graham Smith
articles.description:
The next Call Of Duty will arrive on Game Pass on day one, according to anonymous sources. Microsoft's strategy has long involved releasing all their first-party games on Game Pass, but there had been doubt over whether the same would be true of the first Call Of Duty to be released since Microsoft's $69 billion acquisition of publishers Activision.

 
Read more
articles.title: The next Call Of Duty will launch on Game Pass on day one, reports say

articles.author: Graham Smith
articles.description:
Redfall is getting a final update which will add an offline mode and singleplayer pausing, among other changes. The news was announced via the Redfall account on X, which also thanked players for their "supportive messages" in light of developer Arkane Austin's imminent closure by Microsoft.

 
Read more
articles.title: Redfall will receive one final update after all, including an offline mode

articles.author: Ollie Toms
articles.description:
This weekend is a big one for me. My brand new fancy shmancy ottoman bed is arriving in my new flat, after two weeks of curling up on the sofa with a weighted blanket. I'll also be topping it with my brand new ultra-thick memory foam mattress topper, raising me off the floor another crucial few inches. Think of the view I'll get from up there! To imagine there'll be any time for games! Pah!
I kid. Plenty of time for games for us all, even while reclining on gloriously beds with ungodly amounts of storage space. We love playing games here at Rock Paper Shotgun. Even Alice, who has routinely told me that actually there are no good games. Here's what we'll be clicking on this weekend.
 Read more
articles.title: What are we all playing this weekend?

articles.author: Matt Jarvis
articles.description:
War never changes, and either does Fortnite's love of a crossover. Thus, Fallout and Fortnite are colliding as the post-apocalyptic RPG heads to the battle royale shooter’s upcoming next season.
Read more
articles.title: Fallout is headed to Fortnite’s next season

articles.author: Matt Jarvis
articles.description:
As you might’ve heard, Hades 2 is out in early access, offering up the much-anticipated sequel to Supergiant’s mythical (and delightfully thirsty) roguelite. Though the sheer amount of polish and Stuff in even its pre-release form might have you thinking that a full 1.0 release can’t be too far down the line, the game’s creative director reckons we’ve still got around a year to wait before it’s considered all finished up.
Read more
articles.title: Hades 2 will likely be in early access until 2025, with first big update to add new enemies, maps and features

articles.author: Matt Jarvis
articles.description:
If you’ve been wondering what Valve’s been working on as their next game after Counter-Strike 2, the answer may be at hand. Details and screenshots for Deadlock, a third-person hero shooter with MOBA elements, have seemingly leaked out of a recent closed playtest, revealing a blend of Overwatch, Dota 2 and Valve’s own Team Fortress 2.
Read more
articles.title: Looks like Valve’s next game is Deadlock, a multiplayer shooter-MOBA mix of Overwatch, Dota and Team Fortress

articles.author: Matt Jarvis
articles.description:
Around a week after Microsoft shuttered a number of beloved studios with a track record of making excellent single-player, story-driven games, their newly-owned arm of Activision has revealed a brand new studio. Working on a new series of story-driven, triple-A games.
Read more
articles.title: Activision unveil new studio working on ‘narrative AAA franchise’, days after Microsoft shut Prey and Evil Within devs

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Redakce)
articles.description: Seznam.cz otevřel nové datové centrum Kokura 3. Budova přiléhá k jeho prvnímu datacentru v Horních Počernicích a ukazuje, kam se technologie za uplynulou dekádu posunuly. Projděte se s námi zbrusu novou budovou.
articles.title: Seznam.cz otevřel datacentrum Kokura 3: má moderní chlazení a vyšší kapacitu

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Nastavitelná komprese boot obrazu pro RISC-V, XFS a vylepšený Online Repair, další vylepšení P-State u AMD a Intelu či obecně ACPI, Btrfs norecovery v jiné podobě, novinky u Compute Express Link.
articles.title: Btrfs opět s norecovery, CXL s podporou Resetu a další novinky pro jádro 6.10

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Pavel Tišnovský)
articles.description: Na článek Lorenzův systém: ideální pomůcka pro studium chaosu dnes navážeme. Pokusíme se totiž popsat si některé další dynamické systémy s podivným atraktorem, které je možné vykreslit ve 2D rovině či v 3D prostoru.
articles.title: Od Lorenzova atraktoru k dalším typům atraktorů v ploše i prostoru

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Pavel Satrapa)
articles.description: Součástí odborných textů běžně bývají ukázky programového kódu či konfiguračních souborů. Nejčastěji bývají sázeny neproporcionálním písmem, ale jsou i jiné možnosti. Pojďme se podívat, co v této oblasti nabízí LaTeX.
articles.title: Sazba zdrojových kódů v LaTeXu: balík listings

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Škuta)
articles.description: V redakci pravidelně testujeme notebooky od německé společnosti Tuxedo Computers. Kromě velkých herních notebooků a přenosných pracovních stanic nesmíme vynechat ani zástupce přenosných kancelářských strojů, kterým je je Tuxedo Pulse 14.
articles.title: Tuxedo Pulse 14 Gen 3 a Gen 4: pracovitá šedá myška do kanceláře

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jiří Sluka)
articles.description: V dnešní sklizni se podíváme na nástroje, které vám pomohou zabezpečit vaše digitální secrets, zefektivnit práci s API a udržet krok s nejnovějšími trendy ve světě open-source softwaru.
articles.title: Softwarová sklizeň (29. 5. 2024): ukryjte dobře svá tajemství

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Michal Tauchman)
articles.description: Měli jste u osmibitu disketovou mechaniku? V předchozím článku jsem se věnoval pouhé teorii, v pokračování se již budu věnovat skutečnému hardwaru a tomu, jakou údržbu a servis mu dopřát.
articles.title: Disketová mechanika Commodore 1541-II: rozebrání a vyčistění

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Pavel Tišnovský)
articles.description: Dnes navážeme na článek Emergence: struktury vzniklé ze zdánlivého chaosu, ve kterém jsme si ukázali, jak si můžeme pomocí jednoduchých pravidel nechat vygenerovat komplexní systém. Toto téma souvisí s teorií chaosu a v této oblasti má výsadní postavení Lorenzův systém.
articles.title: Lorenzův systém: ideální pomůcka pro studium chaosu

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: ČD - Telematika)
articles.description: V tomto díle pravidelného bezpečnostního souhrnu se podíváme na problém nemizejících obrázků na zařízeních Apple, zranitelnosti v prohlížeči Google Chrome, záplaty v produktech od Ivanti a účinnost blokování IP adres.
articles.title: Postřehy z bezpečnosti: když smazané fotky neříkají doopravdy sbohem

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Filip Zatloukal)
articles.description: Projekt NetBSD zaujímá stanovisko k předkládání kódu napsaného umělou inteligencí. Firma Murena vydala novou verzi svého operačního systému pro mobilní zařízení /e/OS s číslem 2.0. Vyšel lehký správce oken IceWM 3.5.
articles.title: NetBSD mění přístup k AI, vyšel Murena /e/OS 2.0

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: YouTuber Albino si stěžuje na automatickou kontrolu autorských práv na YouTube. Když streamoval Fallout, jeho pračka Samsung dokončila cyklus a zahrála melodii. Tato melodie byla vyhodnocena jako porušení autorských práv, protože se shoduje s nahrávkou od uživatele Audego starou devět let. Což je vlastně přesně nahraná melodie pračky Samsung. Ke klipu však Audego připojil Content ID, tedy označil jej za vlastní výtvor.
articles.title: Pračka, YouTube a autorská práva

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Andrei Kvapil)
articles.description: Vývojáři svobodné platformy Cozystack (PaaS) vydali nástroj Talm, jehož účelem je zjednodušit konfiguraci serverů s Talos Linuxem, operačním systémem pro nasazení Kubernetes, který má podobné API jako samotné Kubernetes. Přestože byl Talm původně vytvořen pro deklarativní instalaci Cozystack, není specificky vázán na tuto platformu a lze ho použít pro správu jakýchkoliv konfigurací Talos Linuxu.
articles.title: Projekt Cozystack vydal Talm, manažer konfigurací pro Talos Linux

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: V kompresním programu XZ byla před dvěma měsíci objevena šikovně skrytá zadní vrátka CVE-2024–3094. Teoreticky by je bylo možné vzdáleně zneužít přes SSH a knihovnu liblzma, která je součástí XZ. Škodlivé byly verze 5.6 a 5.6.1. Ve středu vyšlo XZ 5.6.2 s již odstraněnými zadními vrátky.
articles.title: Vyšlo XZ 5.6.2 s odstraněnými zadními vrátky

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Společnost Google se drží svého plánu postupně ukončit starší rozšíření pro Chrome, které používají „Manifest V2“. Začne s tím už 3. června, přičemž se to nejprve dotkne vývojářského kanálu Dev a Canary. Uživatelům se budou rozšíření vypínat postupně a vše by mělo být hotovo na začátku příštího roku.
articles.title: Google začne za několik dní vypínat starší rozšíření pro Chrome

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Simon Ser vydal Wayland 1.23, který přináší drobná vylepšení, opravy chyb a vylepšení protokolu Wayland. Nová verze není příliš zajímavá pro uživatele, ale vývojářům by se mohlo hodit několik nových API, vylepšené rozhraní pro ladění a podobně.
articles.title: Wayland nabízí podporu pro OpenBSD

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Canonical oznámil dostupnost real-time jádra pro nedávné vydané Ubuntu 24.04 LTS Noble Numbat. To zajišťuje, aby byly procesy s vysokou prioritou spuštěny jako první a s deterministickou dobou odezvy. Ve srovnání s běžným jádrem tak nabízí výrazně nižší latenci a dovoluje systému bezpečně zpracovávat časově citlivé operace.
articles.title: Canonical představil real-time jádro pro Ubuntu 24.04 LTS

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: anonymní)
articles.description: Chcete se stát forenzním specialistou? Tak je tu pro vás školení Forenzní trénink II., které pořádá sdružení CESNET ve dnech 13. a 14. června v Praze. Dvoudenní školení rozvíjí základy představené v předchozím školení Forenzní trénink 1: Úvod do forenzní analýzy, konkrétně v oblasti analýzy síťového provozu.
articles.title: Školení Forenzní trénink II. - poslední volná místa

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Pavel Štrobl)
articles.description: Kubernetes je spíše spjat s provozem aplikací, které nevyžadují úložiště, tzv. stateless. Jejich provoz je jednodušší, snáze se škálují a obecně rychleji startují. Nicméně, občas je úložiště potřeba a přesně o tom bude další Cloud Native Prague meetup s tématem zvaným Stateful Kubernetes.
articles.title: Cloud Native Prague #13: stateful Kuberenetes již zítra

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Redakce)
articles.description: Chcete se stát datovým analytikem s přesahem do datového inženýrství a v budoucnu se věnovat třeba i strojovému učení či AI? Pak je tu pro vás půlroční intenzivní kurz Datový analytik s Pythonem, kterým vás jednou týdně ve 24 lekcích provedou zkušení lektoři s komerční praxí.
articles.title: Staňte se datovým analytikem s Pythonem (školení)

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Na světě je nová verze AlmaLinux 8.10, která vychází z RHELu 8.10, nicméně oproti RHELu zpětně zavádí podporu některých RAID řadičů, kterou upstream RHELu vyřadil, skrze navrácení podpory pro některá PCI ID, kde není nutná změna kódu ovladače. AlmaLinux 8.10 tak víceméně dělá pro systémové správce strojů s těmito řadiči zhruba totéž, co AlmaLinux 9.4 oproti RHELu 9.4, navíc s tím bonusem, že se mohou nadále držet „osmičkové“ řady. Viz seznam inkriminovaných zařízení.
articles.title: AlmaLinux 8.10 též s RAID ovladači, které RHEL nepodporuje

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Čerstvá oprava pro kernelový nástroj cpupower odteď zajistí, že majitelé budoucích procesorů generace AMD Zen 5 budou mít k dispozici správně fungující reportování P-state frekvencí, tedy pracovní frekvence v (nejen) úsporných stavech chodu CPU.
articles.title: Oprava cpupower pro AMD Zen 5 míří do jádra

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Společnost Canonical oznámila, že je k dispozici optimalizovaný obraz Ubuntu 24.04 pro Milk-V Mars, první výkonný jednodeskový počítač RISC-V (SBC) velikosti platební karty, který dodala společnost Shenzhen MilkV Technology.
articles.title: Ubuntu má podporu pro jednodeskový počítač s RISC-V zvaný Milk-V Mars

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Společnost OVHcloud dnes oznámila spuštění své první pražské lokální zóny veřejného cloudu (Public Cloud Local Zone). Pražští zákazníci tak mají přístup ke cloudovým službám se sníženou latencí a lokálním umístěním dat. Nová zóna navíc plně odpovídá evropským předpisům o digitální suverenitě a bezpečnosti a splňuje přísné standardy organizací z finančního, bankovního nebo vládního sektoru, píše se v oznámení.
articles.title: OVHcloud spouští svou pražskou lokální zónu

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: PeoplePath)
articles.description: Společnost PeoplePath pořádá v Plzni jednou za dva měsíce workshopy na různá IT témata. Tentokrát bylo hlavním tématem PHPUnit a byl pořízen videozáznam.
articles.title: Video z workshopu Úvod do testování s PHPUnit

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Otevřený ovladač Intel iVPU pro NPU (Neural Processing Unit) od tohoto výrobce, které se objevily v procesorech aktuální mobilní řady Meteor Lake, prodělává refactoring. Vývojáři Intelu zaslali sadu patchů, která mění ovladač hardwarové vrstvy NPU tak, aby do budoucna flexibilněji sloužil různým konfiguracím NPU v procesorech Intel.
articles.title: Refactoring ovladače NPU Intel pro lepší práci CPU a NPU

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Vývojář Mika Laitio hledal cestu jak si usnadnit používání balíku AMD ROCm a strojového učení na CPU a GPU AMD. Podařilo se mu vytvořit balík skriptů, který za uživatele zařídí hromadu ruční práce (sám instaluje a kompiluje dobrých 80 dílčích projektů) a vše udržuje v jednom projektovém adresáři, včetně vlastního buildu jazyka Python. Svůj projekt umístil na Github k volnému užití.
articles.title: ROCM SDK Builder, cesta jak instalovat Machine Learning od AMD pro běžná GPU

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Včerejší finále mistrovství světa v ledním hokeji, kde česká reprezentace vyhrála zlaté medaile, přineslo i několik dalších rekordů. Peeringový uzel NIX.CZ ve 21:15 zaznamenal rekordní provoz 3,14 Tbps. Rekord zaznamenal i operátor O2, který zajišťoval internetové vysílání i pro Českou televizi. Zde ve 22:40 provoz překročil 3 Tbps.
articles.title: Při finále v hokeji tekl uzlem NIX.CZ rekordní provoz 3,14 Tbps

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Další ročník konference LinuxDays začal přijímat přednášky. Pokud máte co říct, můžete už teď přihlásit své téma. Organizátory zajímají především témata týkající se Linuxu, open source, sítí, bezpečnosti, vývoje a podobně. Mezi návštěvníky jsou jak začátečníci, tak i velmi zkušení odborníci. Nemusíte se tedy bát přidat své téma.
articles.title: Přihlaste přednášku na LinuxDays 2024

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Nintendo Switch je herní konzole založená na Nvidia Tegra X1 (4× ARM Cortex A57 1,02 GHz, 4 GB RAM, Nvidia Maxwell GPU). Pro Switch existuje neoficiální software Switchroot, který umožní spustit Linux nebo Android. Funguje i dualboot s oficiálním Switch OS.
articles.title: Ubuntu 24.04 na Nintendo Switch

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Redakce)
articles.description: Proxmox je moderní virtualizační platforma, která v mnoha případech může nahradit VMware. Je open-source, zdarma a je postaven na otevřených technologiích jako KVM, LXC, CEPH a dalších. Pokud potřebujete provozovat virtualizaci, Proxmox je pro vás ideální stack a na našem workshopu Proxmox se dozvíte, jak na něj.
articles.title: Proxmox: moderní virtualizační platforma schopná nahradit VMware (školení)

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Jádro 6.10 bude podporovat zapečetění paměti mseal. Tuto funkci navrhl Jeff Xu, vývojář Chrome minulý rok v říjnu. Linus Torvalds měl k mseal některé výhrady, ty se ale podařilo postupně překonat.
articles.title: Jádro 6.10 bude podporovat zapečetění paměti

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Tomáš Heřmánek)
articles.description: Pokud vás zajímá monitoring, můžete využít série bezplatných webinářů a nově i workshopů zaměřených na nejnovější verzi Zabbixu 7.0. Přijďte a získejte podrobné informace o nových funkcích, praktické tipy a triky a osvědčené postupy, které vám pomohou optimalizovat vaše monitorovací řešení. Nepropásněte tuto příležitost posunout své znalosti Zabbixu na vyšší úroveň a dozvědět se vše nejen o nové verzi.
articles.title: Pozvánka na webináře o Zabbix 7.0: novinky a praktické workshopy zdarma

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Kdysi velmi populární nástroj pro zasílání zpráv ICQ bude 26. června definitivně vypnut. Služba ICQ je pojmenována podle anglického „I seek you“ a byla spuštěna v roce 1996, jen krátce před službou AOL Instant Messenger. Byla oblíbená pro své snadné používání, chatování s konkrétními uživateli nebo ve skupinách a možnost komunikovat s lidmi z celého světa v reálném čase a zdarma.
articles.title: ICQ končí, 26. června ho po 28 letech provozovatel vypne

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Box86 a Box64 jsou linuxové emulátory instrukcí x86 a x86_64. Umožňují tedy například běh Steamu a her na procesorech ARM. Mezi novinkami je dynamická detekce pagesize. Což umožní běh na Apple ARM a Raspberry Pi 5 (64bitové jádro), protože oba mají pagesize 16k, místo ve světě x86 běžných 4k.
articles.title: Nový Box86 0.3.6 a Box64 0.2.8 fungují na Apple ARM a na Raspberry Pi 5

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Nedávno jsme tu měli změnu pro jádro 6.10, která umožní konfiguraci NFS serveru pomocí nového nástroje nfsdctl. Do jádra 6.10 směřuje ještě jedna změna pro NFS. Ve výchozím stavu bude vypnuto NFSv2 z roku 1989.
articles.title: Jádro 6.10 vypne ve výchozím nastavení NFSv2

articles.author: Reklama
articles.description: Ať už hledáte levnější způsob jak postavit nový počítač, nebo jen upgradovat stárnoucí kopii Office, tato nabídka na Goodoffer24.com vám určitě pomůže, protože je skvělá, tak na co čekat?
articles.title: Zvláštní slevy na software v pololetí, Windows 11 za €20 a mnoho dalších na Goodoffer24

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Ucelený přehled článků, zpráviček a diskusí za minulých 7 dní.
articles.title: Událo se v týdnu 22/2024

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Rekapitulace jarních vydání nejen linuxových distribucí: obvyklý Fedora Linux a Ubuntu tentokrát LTS s četnými deriváty, ale také KANOTIX, IPFire, Clonezilla live, NetBSD, EndeavourOS, TrueNAS SCALE, Tails, OSMC, Proxmox, RISC OS či metadistribuce T2 SDE.
articles.title: Distribuční novinky 16-17/2024

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Studie HP Wolf Security odhaluje aktuálně využívané metody kyberútoků. Acer představuje svůj první Copilot+ notebook Swift 14 s umělou inteligencí. Fortinet představuje prvního bezpečnostního asistenta pro IoT s generativní umělou inteligencí. Dell Technologies představuje ochranu dat v multicloudu. Výkonný elektromagnet z 3D tiskárny.
articles.title: Týden na ITBiz: Výkonný elektromagnet z 3D tiskárny

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Ucelený přehled článků, zpráviček a diskusí za minulých 7 dní.
articles.title: Událo se v týdnu 21/2024

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Před 70 lety vznikl první křemíkový solární článek. Webbův dalekohled zachytil nejvzdálenější fúzi černých děr. Malé modulární jaderné reaktory se blíží do Česka. Z čeho se skládá kosmické záření. Nový výzkum spojuje kyslík s technologickou civilizací.
articles.title: Týden na ScienceMag.cz: Neutronové molekuly – neutrony se mohou vázat na kvantové tečky

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Trh se službami cloudové infrastruktury zaznamenává již druhé čtvrtletí vyšší než očekávaný růst. Kyberzločinci zneužívají nové zranitelnosti o 43 % rychleji než před rokem. Polovina českých firem si není jistá blízkou budoucnosti svého oboru, většina ale počítá s velkým vlivem AI. Pure Storage a Red Hat urychlují zavádění moderní virtualizace v podnicích. Nová služba Acronis MDR s integrovanou obnovou po útoku.
articles.title: Týden na ITBiz: Polovina českých firem si není jistá blízkou budoucnosti svého oboru, většina ale počítá s velkým vlivem AI

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Ucelený přehled článků, zpráviček a diskusí za minulých 7 dní.
articles.title: Událo se v týdnu 20/2024

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Další teorie se chce obejít bez temné hmoty i energie. Grafenový inkoust pro levný a dostupný tisk senzorů. Navrhli novou metodu detekce prvních hvězd. Změřili gravitaci blízko kvantovému světu. HPE postavila nejvýkonnější superpočítač v Polsku.
articles.title: Týden na ScienceMag.cz: Působivá simulace pádu do černé díry

articles.author: Reklama
articles.description: Je tady květen a ti, kdo se chystají sestavit si novou mašinu budou mít příležitost obětovat větší částku za hardwarové komponenty, nebo přidat si za nějaké další licence, které hned nenašli na Goodoffer24.com, zde mají velké slevy nabízené v porovnání s oficiálními ceníky.
articles.title: Květnový výprodej na Goodoffer24 nabízí Windows 11 Pro za €20 a mnoho dalších slev

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Nové portfolio tiskáren HP navržené s ohledem na udržitelnost, bezpečnost i efektivitu práce. Posilování kybernetické odolnosti v éře umělé inteligence. Red Hat usnadňuje vytváření modelů AI. Platby výkupného za ransomware vzrostly za poslední rok na pětinásobek. 96 % firem má obavy o zabezpečení cloudů. Zároveň jim chybí odborníci.
articles.title: Týden na ITBiz: Platby výkupného za ransomware vzrostly za poslední rok na pětinásobek

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Byla vydána nová stabilní verze 24.05 linuxové distribuce NixOS (Wikipedie). Její kódové označení je Uakari. Podrobný přehled novinek v poznámkách k vydání. O balíčky se v NixOS stará správce balíčků Nix.
articles.title: NixOS 24.05 Uakari

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Byla vydána nová verze 1.48.0 sady nástrojů pro správu síťových připojení NetworkManager. Novinkám se v příspěvku na blogu NetworkManageru věnuje Fernando F. Mancera. Mimo jiné se v nastavení místo mac-address-blacklist nově používá mac-address-denylist.
articles.title: NetworkManager 1.48.0

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Před 25 lety, 31. května 1999, započal vývoj grafického editoru Krita (Wikipedie). Tenkrát ještě pod názvem KImageShop a později pod názvem Krayon.
articles.title: 25 let Krity

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Farid Abdelnour se v příspěvku na blogu rozepsal o novinkám v nejnovější verzi 24.05.0 editoru videa Kdenlive (Wikipedie). Ke stažení brzy také na Flathubu.
articles.title: Novinky v Kdenlive 24.05.0

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: David Revoy, autor mj. komiksu Pepper&Carrot, se rozepsal o své aktuální grafické pracovní stanici: Debian 12 Bookworm, okenní systém X11, KDE Plasma 5.27, …
articles.title: David Revoy: aktuální grafická pracovní stanice

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Wayland (Wikipedie) byl vydán ve verzi 1.23.0. Z novinek lze vypíchnout podporu OpenBSD.
articles.title: Wayland 1.23.0

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Craig Loewen na blogu Microsoftu představil novinky ve Windows Subsystému pro Linux (WSL). Vypíchnout lze GUI aplikaci pro nastavování WSL nebo správu WSL z Dev Home.
articles.title: Novinky ve Windows Subsystému pro Linux (05/2024)

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: V sobotu 1. června lze navštívit Maker Faire Ostrava, festival plný workshopů, interaktivních činností a především nadšených a zvídavých lidí.
articles.title: Maker Faire Ostrava

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Webový server Caddy (Wikipedie) s celou řadou zajímavých vlastností byl vydán ve verzi 2.8 (𝕏). Přehled novinek na GitHubu.
articles.title: Caddy 2.8

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Byla vydána verze 3.0 (@, 𝕏) svobodného softwaru HAProxy (The Reliable, High Performance TCP/HTTP Load Balancer; Wikipedie) řešícího vysokou dostupnost, vyvažování zátěže a reverzní proxy. Detailní přehled novinek v příspěvku na blogu společnosti HAProxy Technologies.
articles.title: HAProxy 3.0

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: It's been another busy week with the open-source AMD Linux graphics driver stack with continued preparations around enabling support for next-generation RDNA4 graphics (as well as continued RDNA3+ / RDNA 3.5 tuning)...
articles.title: VCN5 AV1 Encode & More AMD RDNA4 RADV Support Land In Mesa 24.2

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: As some more exciting news for upcoming Xe2 graphics with Lunar Lake integrated graphics and Battlemage discrete GPUs, the latest open-source driver activity for Linux has confirmed Xe2 supporting native 64-bit integer arithmetic...
articles.title: Intel Xe2 Brings Native 64-bit Integer Arithmetic

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: While the Gentoo Linux project recently established an AI policy to forbid contributions to the project made using any AI tools/assistance and NetBSD also came out with a similar policy against AI-generated code, the Debian project for now has no project-wide policy regarding AI...
articles.title: Debian Has Yet To Establish Firm Stance On The Use Of AI

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: May 2024 is now in the books with 285 original news articles written by your's truly last month along with another 14 Linux hardware reviews / multi-page featured benchmark articles. It was an interesting month with some fun new hardware launches, the Linux 6.10 merge window taking place, and other open-source software progress...
articles.title: NVIDIA Open Kernel Driver News, AMD EPYC 4004 & Linux 6.10 Made For A Fun May

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: It's not too common for Intel to publish new CPU microcode updates outside of their "Patch Tuesday" regiment but that happened yesterday with a Friday night release of new CPU microcode although this time is limited to the Celeron and Pentium Silver families...
articles.title: Intel Releases Updated Celeron & Pentium Silver CPU Microcode

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Expressed last week was a "major issue" from the GNOME Foundation side with regard to the Sovereign Tech Fund partnership for funding a number of useful improvements to the GNOME software stack just as Germany's STF has been doing to a number of other prominent open-source projects. While there still aren't many clear public details on this "major issue", a Friday night update from the GNOME side seems to indicate all is well and they are also embarking on additional development funding initiatives...
articles.title: GNOME Shares Update On Sovereign Tech Fund & Other Development Funding

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Vulkan 1.3.286 was released today with a handful of corrections/clarifications as well as one new extension...
articles.title: Vulkan 1.3.286 Released With One New Extension

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Wine 9.10 is out today as the newest bi-weekly development release for this open-source software to enjoy Windows games/applications on Linux and other operating systems...
articles.title: Wine 9.10 Released With Upgrade To VKD3D 1.12, Brings DPI Awareness Improvements

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: The open-source Godot game engine has worked its way up to the Godot 4.3 Beta 1 milestone with some exciting achievements...
articles.title: Godot 4.3 Beta 1 Released With Native Wayland Support

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Jean-Baptiste Kempf released Dav1d 1.4.2 as the newest version of this speedy CPU-based AV1 video decoder. With this new dav1d 1.4.2 update are yet more performance optimizations for modern systems...
articles.title: Dav1d 1.4.2 Provides More AVX2 & AVX-512 Performance Optimizations

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Intel engineer Noah Goldstein has landed another nice performance optimization in the GNU C Library "glibc" for benefiting newer Intel processors...
articles.title: Intel Lands A Nice Memset Performance Optimization In Glibc

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Right now when dealing with quirky/buggy touchscreens a C file needs to be manually manipulated and the Linux kernel recompiled. With a new "i2c_touchscreen_props" kernel command line option on its way to the mainline kernel, the process of overriding touchscreen properties is dramatically easier for those dealing with Linux on touchscreen-enabled devices...
articles.title: Linux 6.10 Is Making It Much Easier To Deal With Quirky Touchscreens

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Bcachefs lead developer Kent Overstreet sent in a batch of file-system fixes on Thursday for the in-development Linux 6.10 kernel. In that pull request he teased features that are set to arrive with the Linux 6.11 kernel later in the summer...
articles.title: Bcachefs Preparing For New Features In Linux 6.11

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Last month we began seeing AMDGPU driver firmware files published for the rumored "RDNA3+" hardware as an RDNA3 refresh (also as "RDNA 3.5") for upcoming APUs. More firmware files have now landed public in linux-firmware.git for these forthcoming RDNA3 refresh products...
articles.title: More AMDGPU Linux Firmware Published For RDNA 3+

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: If the recent release of Flowblade 2.16 video editor wasn't of interest to you due to being GTK-based software, the Qt/KDE-aligned Kdenlive video editor is out this week with its Kdenlive 24.05 feature release...
articles.title: Kdenlive 24.05 Brings Multi-Format Rendering, Automatic Subtitle Translations

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Simon Ser today released Wayland 1.23 for this core Wayland code that brings some minor enhancements, bug fixes, and Wayland protocol clarifications...
articles.title: Wayland 1.23 Released With OpenBSD Support

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Given Microsoft's recent BUILD conference, Microsoft has announced a number of sizable updates to Windows Subsystem for Linux (WSL)...
articles.title: Microsoft Rolling Out New Windows Subsystem For Linux "WSL" Features For 2024

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Last week with the AMD EPYC 4004 review and benchmarks I tested nearly the entire product stack for these new AM5-based server processors with the EPYC 4244P (6 cores), EPYC 4344P (8 cores), EPYC 4364P (8 cores), EPYC 4464P (12 cores), EPYC 4484X (12 cores + 3D V-Cache), EPYC 4564P (16 cores), and EPYC 4584PX (16 cores + 3D V-Cache). The only EPYC 4004 class processor I wasn't able to finish testing in time was the entry-level EPYC 4124P as a 4-core processor with $149 retail price. I've now had the time to finish benchmarking that budget-focused Zen 4 server processor as well as seeing how it compares to the 4-core Skylake Xeons that were prolific for years.
articles.title: AMD EPYC 4124P Benchmarks: A Quad-Core $149 Server CPU

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: It's been more than two years now talking about the Anaconda installer for Fedora/RHEL shifting to a web-based UI. Going back to Fedora 37 have been previews and plans for getting this modern user interface up to parity but it's been a long road. With repeated delays, there's at least one more delay: the Anaconda web UI was just shifted from Fedora 41 to Fedora 42...
articles.title: Fedora's New Web-Based Installer UI Delayed Yet Again... Now In 2025 With Fedora 42

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Similar to the real-time kernel for Ubuntu 22.04 LTS, Canonical announced today the availability of their new real-time "RT" kernel for Ubuntu 24.04 LTS. But like with the existing Ubuntu RT kernels, this real-time support is limited to Ubuntu Pro subscriptions...
articles.title: Real-Time Kernel Now Available On Ubuntu 24.04 LTS

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: The Rust-written Servo web engine as a reminder was started as a Mozilla project but then abandoned and now developed by multiple organizations as part of Linux Foundation Europe. The Servo project has put out a new status update that highlights the work accomplished in recent weeks...
articles.title: Servo Web Engine Continues Advancing But Seeing Just $1.6k In Monthly Donations

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Yocto 5.0 LTS has been released as the newest version from the Yocto Project that is popular for organizations assembling their own embedded/IoT-minded custom Linux distributions. The Linux Foundation also announced today that Boeing has become a Platinum Member with Yocto...
articles.title: Yocto 5.0 LTS Released - Now Powered By Linux 6.6 LTS, Boeing Joins The Project

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: It's rare for an advanced media briefing to involve representatives from both AMD and Intel, but that happened yesterday. AMD and Intel along with Broadcom have formed the Ultra Accelerator Link "UALink" as a new open standard they are hoping to use to take on NVIDIA's proprietary NVLink interface...
articles.title: AMD & Intel Team Up For UALink As Open Alternative To NVIDIA's NVLink

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: The Intel Battlemage discrete graphics support is beginning to come together for the open-source Linux graphics driver stack as the successor to DG2/Alchemist. In addition to all the Xe2 work for what's found with Lunar Lake, more Battlemage Linux kernel and user-space driver work has been appearing recently. The milestone crossed today is the initial Battlemage "BMG" platform support being merged for the Mesa 24.2 OpenGL/Vulkan drivers...
articles.title: Intel Battlemage Platform Support Begins Landing In Mesa 24.2

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: As part of Intel's Flexible Return Event Delivery (FRED), Intel open-source software engineers are now working on improving Non-Maskable Interrupt (NMI) source reporting for the Linux kernel...
articles.title: Intel Improving NMI Source Reporting On Linux With FRED

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Building off the PowerVR kernel driver merged in Linux 6.8 and PowerVR Vulkan driver in Mesa 24.0 that are both focused on Imagination's newer PowerVR Rogue architecture, Google engineers are working on enabling open-source driver support for the PowerVR Rogue GX6250 as found within the MediaTek MT8173 SoC...
articles.title: Google Enabling PowerVR Rogue GX6250 Open-Source Support With The MediaTek MT8173

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Last year the KDAB consulting firm typically associated with Qt work published KDGpu as a thin Vulkan wrapper to make it easier leveraging this graphics API. Out today is KDGpu v0.5 with many improvements to this Vulkan wrapper...
articles.title: KDGpu v0.5 Vulkan Wrapper Released, KDXr Begins Wrapping OpenXR

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: While VKD3D-Proton that is bundled with Valve's Steam Play (Proton) is the most common source for mapping Direct3D 12 over the Vulkan API for Windows games on Linux, Wine's VKD3D upstream continues to be developed. Out today is VKD3D 1.12 as the newest feature release for this open-source D3D12-on-Vulkan implementation...
articles.title: VKD3D 1.12 Released With Support For Directly Outputting SPIR-V & D3D Shader Assembly

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: It was two months ago today that an urgent security alert was issued over XZ being hit by malicious code that turned out to be a backdoor within liblzma added by a bad actor that worked his way into XZ co-maintainership. Longtime XZ developer Lasse Collin is back at the helm and has been auditing the prior XZ commits and today released XZ 5.6.2 with the backdoor completely removed...
articles.title: XZ 5.6.2 Released With The Frightening Backdoor Removed

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: A massive uptick in traffic to Fedora's package mirrors is causing problems for the Linux distribution. Some five million additional systems have started putting additional strain on Fedora's mirror resources since March and appear to be coming from Amazon's cloud...
articles.title: Amazon Cloud Traffic Is Suffocating Fedora's Mirrors

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Framework is out today with some exciting announcements from lowering the price of the existing Framework 13 with AMD Ryzen 7040 series SoC to announcing a new Framework Laptop 13 powered by Intel Core Ultra (Meteor Lake) and having a new 2.8K display option for this modular/upgradeable laptop shipping this summer...
articles.title: Framework Announces Intel Core Ultra Powered Laptop With 2.8k Display

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Now that the Linux 6.10 merge window has wrapped up, here's a look at all of the exciting features/changes coming to this summer 2024 kernel. Linux 6.10 brings a lot as usual for the latest/upcoming Intel and AMD platforms, never-ending work on file-systems, a new memory sealing "mseal" system call, TPM bus encryption, and dozens of other exciting changes and new hardware support.
articles.title: Linux 6.10 Features Include TPM Bus Encryption, More AMD Zen 5 & A Prison Letter Merge Request
Modes of Transportation
Complexity Analysis
Local Group
Room Code

articles.author: Daphne Fama
articles.description:
Taking down the Rocket Leaders each month is the joy of being a trainer. Here’s how to defeat Cliff in Pokemon Go in June 2024. 


How to Counter Cliff in Pokémon GO (June 2024)


Cliff is essentially a slab of muscle, and so are his Pokémon. But don’t think you won’t need a strategy to bring him down. The best Pokémon to field against Cliff in Pokémon Go are:



Metagross with Zen Headbutt or Bullet Punch, Meteor Mash.


Rayquaza with Air Slash, Dragon Ascent, or Ancient Power.


Lucario with Bullet Punch, Power-Up Punch.



How to defeat Cliff’s first Pokémon in Pokémon GO (June 2024)


Image by Destructoid


Now, let’s get into the nitty-gritty details. Cliff’s first Pokemon will be a Shadow Machop, which you’ll be able to capture if you beat Cliff. And, yes, Machop can be Shiny. Becaus…
articles.title: How to beat Cliff in Pokémon Go: Best counters, team lineup, and strategy (June 2024)

articles.author: Kristina Ebanez
articles.description:
The Team Rocket boss, Giovanni, knows his way around the battlefield, especially with his elite ensemble of creatures. We're here to help you defeat him in Pokémon Go by showing you the best Giovanni counters, team lineup, and strategies. 


How to defeat Giovanni in Pokémon Go


Once you activate the Super Rocket Radar from the "It's a Rocket World" quest, you can pinpoint Giovanni's location at PokéStops or Team Rocket balloons. Before heading into battle, it's essential to equip the right team members. Depending on your Pokémon Go selection, here are a few ways you can decide on a group for Giovanni:


Best team lineup for Giovanni in Pokémon Go



Fighting Type: Annihilape, Machamp, Lucario, Conkeldurr, Terrakion, Iron Valiant, or Keldeo


Water Type: Vaporeon, Swampert, Kyogre, Azumar…
articles.title: How to beat Giovanni in Pokémon Go: Best counters, team lineup, and strategy (June 2024)

articles.description:
Raid battles are the ultimate test of Pokémon Go as they pit you against the most elite Pokémon out there. To make it even more challenging, the lineup continuously adjusts over time, changing your team with it. So, to keep up to date, here's the June 2024 Pokémon Go Raid schedule.

articles.author: Cody Perez
articles.description:
One of the most beautiful parts of building a new LEGO set is tackling it alongside someone else. If that person happens to be your significant other, it can even double as a wonderful date night or bonding experience. These 10 LEGO sets, in particular, are the best when it comes to offering ideas, themes, difficulty, or projects couples can enjoy together. 


Image via LEGO

Rivers of London was written by author Ben Aaronovitch and is a masterful series set mostly around the city of London in the UK that blends grounded police policies, a fantastical world within our own, and Aaronovitch's own excruciatingly precise memory for the details of London's streets. 


When I first picked this series up, I thought I'd be reading a murder mystery novel set in London that was grounded and offered a good twist ending. That's not what I got, but I'm so glad it wasn't because the Rivers of London series is so much better. The series has grown over time and now encompasses smaller novellas, meaning it can be difficult to understand what order to read them all. Izuku Midoriya's hero journey started when All Might chose him to inherit One For All — the very same Quirk that allowed a Quirkless All Might to become the symbol of justice.


Initially, One For All is thought to only grant immense strength. As such, the user's body must be strong enough to endure the strain of releasing that much explosive power. But as the story progressed, the mysteries involving One For All slowly unraveled. It turned out that One For All not only passes superstrength from one user to another but also the Quirks the previous users wielded.

Kagaya Ubuyashiki has always been painted as physically pained. Despite attempting to train himself in swordsmanship, his body simply cannot endure the physical strain. The newest season of Demon Slayer follows the main cast of characters as they train to eventually fight against Mugen's demons. Based on the manga, this season of the anime gives the characters life through animation while adding extra fluff for more character development and interactions. 


To help you follow along with each episode as it releases, here is the full Demon Slayer Hashira Training Arc release schedule. 


Demon Slayer Hashira Training Arc



Episode 1 release date: May 12, 2024


Episode 2 release date: May 19, 2024 


Episode 3 release date: May 26, 2024


Episode 4 release date: June 2, 2024 


Episode 5 release date: June 9, 2024 


Episode 6 release date: June 16, 2024


Episode 7 release date: June 23, 2024


Episode 8 release date: June 30, 2024 





The fourth season of Demon Slayer releases weekly every Sunday. Each release time is around 10:45 AM PT. Simply convert the time zone to your respective area's time zone. 


Ufotable, the animation studio responsible for Demon Slayer, always does consistent weekly releases. They have no planned breaks for the season. Therefore, each episode should be released promptly on Sunday.


Unlike the previous seasons, which were all over 10 episodes long, Demon Slayer Hashira Training Arc is rumored to be far shorter. As of now, there appears to be no official announcement -- but many in the community are in resounding agreement that it'll be eight episodes. This speculation is based on the length of the arc in the manga, which is only eight chapters long, making for roughly one episode per chapter. 


If they officially announce the number of episodes, expect this article to be updated with the appropriate information.

How to complete Breaking Brick Mountains in Final Fantasy XIV


Screenshot by Destructoid


If you want to take part in Breaking Brick Mountains, head to Ul’dah and talk to Havak Alvak on the Steps of Nald (X:12.1, Y:8.2) directly opposite the Adventurer’s Guild. After some discussion, you’ll find that you need to take part in a couple of FATEs:



Brick by Stone Brick


Brick by Gold Brick



These FATEs spawn directly after one another in the same location, and there are five different locations where they can possibly spawn:



Sil'dih Excavation Site, Central Thanalan (X:18.0, Y:23.5)


Blind Iron Mines, Lower La Noscea (X:27.0, Y:17.3)


Camp Bronze Lake, Upper La Noscea (X:34.1, Y:24.1)


Bentbranch Meadows, Central Shroud (X:23.6, Y:23.9)


Finders’ Bluff, North Shroud (X:15.8, Y:31.0)



Once you’ve completed these two FATEs, head back to Ul’dah - Steps of Nald and talk to the Burly Businessman (X:8.2, Y:12.4). This will complete the event quest and reward you with the following items:



Thug’s Mug


Wind-up Brickman 



How to get the King Slime Crown in Final Fantasy XIV 


Image via Square Enix


To get the iconic King Slime Crown, you’ll need to have completed the main quest of the Breaking Brick Mountains, including the FATEs. 


Once you’ve done this, Talk to Toughie in Ul’dah - Steps of Nald, where you will now be able to purchase the King Slime crown for 57 Gil.

articles.author: Terry Oh
articles.description:
After numerous bigger than life adventures, Edens Zero draws close to its inevitable conclusion. In a couple more chapters, Shiki Granbell will have accomplished his monumental task -- making the end of an era for fans of the series. As to avoid spoilers, I'll leave out direct story elements from this article. Here is everything to know regarding Edens Zero chapter 290. 


When does Edens Zero chapter 290 come out? 


According to Weekly Shonen Magazine, Edens Zero chapter 290 releases June 4, 2024. As a part of Weekly Shonen Magazine, Eden Zero's new chapter release date is the day a new magazine issue drops. The speculated release time is 8 am PST, a time based on the upload of the chapter in the previous week. 


Weekly Shonen Magazine releases every Wednesday in Japan, which is every Tuesday in the US. Therefore, the Edens Zero chapter 290 release date is on June 4, assuming there are no complications that delay the release.


For those wanting to read it for free, you can check in on the kmanga's official site on June 9, 2024. This is five days after its initial release. You can also read it as part of volume set 29, which releases on June 25, 2024. 


What to expect


Hiro Mashima, the creator of Edens Zero, has begun wrapping up loose ends for the series. Rather than prolonging the series' life, like how he did with Fairy Tail, Mashima is approaching Edens Zero closer to how he approached Rave Master. In essence, he's going for a concise story rather than a drawn-out one. 




Even after Edens Zero ends, fans will likely see many of the characters again in the near future. Hiro Mashima has a tendency to recycle character designs and concepts in his future series. Therefore, although we will soon have to say goodbye to the series, we may not have to say bid our farewells to all the characters. 

The post Edens Zero chapter 290 release date, time, and what to expect appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: Edens Zero chapter 290 release date, time, and what to expect

articles.author: Drew Kopp
articles.description:
The New York Times has sued an offshoot of its viral web game Wordle. Again. If I had to guess, the word of the day is "petty."


This time, the [insert-word-here]-le game on the legal chopping block is Worldle, a geography-themed puzzle game designed by Seattle-based developer Kory McDonald. Averaging around 100,000 players a month, Worldle presents you with the outline of a specific country or territory and challenges you to guess which one it is. It's like a highly condensed version of Where in the World is Carmen Sandiego?, but you aren't looking for a trench-coated spy.


Unfortunately, Worldle is now in the crosshairs of the New York Times, which purchased Wordle from its original developer, Josh Wardle, for an undisclosed seven-figure sum back in 2022. In a legal document obtained by the BBC, The New York Times argues that McDonald is trying to "cause confusion" and take advantage of Wordle's "enormous goodwill".


I'll be the first to admit that Worldle shares more than a few DNA strands with Wordle, but McDonald is far from the first developer to coast off of Wordle's success. There's a Wordle clone for mathematicians, music lovers, and Pokemon fans. I'm especially fond of the last one, myself.


This isn't even the first time the New York Times has sicced the metaphorical hounds on a game inspired by Wordle. The newspaper has proven to be immensely protective of what has become one of its most marketable investments, filing DMCAs against many Wordle-inspired games. If there's an -le at the end of its title, the game may as well paint a target on itself.


Fortunately for Worldle fans, McDonald told the BBC that he's not letting his game go down without a fight, telling the interviewer that "worst-case scenario, we'll change the name, but I think we'll be okay.”

The post The New York Times is suing another Wordle off-shoot appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: The New York Times is suing another Wordle off-shoot

ALS, which is commonly referred to as Lou Gehrig's disease, forced the baseball legend to retire at the age of 36. The seven-time All-Star and six-time World Series Champion had the Lou Gehrig Memorial Award named after him, and is given annually to the MLB player who best exemplifies integrity and character. 


Gehrig brought a combination of power and contact on the field, winning a batting title and a Triple Crown. Here is everything you need to know about adding the slugger to your lineup.

articles.description:
Once you find Slurp Cactus in Fortnite, they can help you gain shields and finish a weekly quest. Here's where to spot them in this big battle royale open world. 


Slurp Cactus in Fortnite location


The Slurp Cactus is a new interactive object in Fortnite that lets you gain shields after ramming it with a vehicle or hitting it with a weapon. They can be found all over the new desert area to the south of the Chapter 5 Season 3 map. Find a car near a location like the Nitrodome and while driving, look on both sides of the road. You'll see cacti that have blue gooey leaves on them. Ram into these plants and you'll gain a shield boost. 


Screenshots by Destructoid


One of the Weekly Quests asks you to restore 300 health or shields with the Slurp Cactus. Once this is completed, you'll net yourself 15,000 XP. It also accounts for the bonus goals, which ask you to complete a certain amount of Weekly Quests. If you finish 12, for example, there is a 25K experience bonus.


Other Weekly Quests in Fortnite Chapter 5 Season 3


The other weekly quests in Fortnite Chapter 5 Season 3 are a cakewalk. Nitro Fists are a new weapon in the game that let you punch your foes to elimination. Get 400 damage with the Nitro Fists, and you'll get yourself another 15K experience points. The best way to take them out is to uppercut them, then smash your fists down while you're in the air. 


Additionally, you can damage opponents with your car by either ramming them or modding a weapon to the top of your vehicle. You can collect them from boxes strewn throughout the map. Another quest is to go through a Flaming Boost Hoop.

After The Legend of Zelda: Ocarina of Time reinvented the series in 3D and became its new gold standard, Nintendo followed up with a surreal sequel in Majora's Mask. Set two months after the events of Ocarina, Link finds himself transported to an alternate version of Hyrule called Termina and must prevent a very angry moon from crashing into the Earth over the course of three constantly repeating days. Majora's Mask's unique structure and bizarre tone have earned it legions of passionate defenders and detractors, and one long-time Zelda fan is going to experience it for the first time to see where he lands on that spectrum.
Join Marcus Stewart and Kyle Hilliard today and each Friday on Twitch at 1:00 p.m. CT as they gradually work their way through the entire game until Termina is saved. Archived episodes will be uploaded each Saturday on our second YouTube channel Game Informer Shows, which you can watch both above and by clicking the links below.
